conclusion: Objects meet when areas under their velocity-time curves are equal.
Object A's velocity decreases from v₀ to 0 over t₁, then rises linearly to v₀ at t₂.
Object B is at rest until t₂, then its velocity increases concave up from 0 to v₀, reaching v₀ at t₄.
Displacement of A from 0 to t₁ is the area of the left shaded curve.
From t₁ to t₂, A’s displacement is the area of the triangle under the straight-line rise.
Displacement of B from t₂ to t₄ is the area under its rising curve.
Total area under A’s curve from 0 → t₂ equals total area under B’s curve from t₂ → t₄.
Two shaded regions are equal at time t₃ where the two curves intersect.
The two objects meet at t = t₃.
